title: Steve Berryman
text:
Steve Berryman is a former professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> and <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> footballer who played the 1990s, 2000s and 2010s. He played representative level rugby league (RL) for the <a href="New%20Zealand%20M%C4%81ori%20rugby%20league%20team">New Zealand Māori team</a> and <a href="Cook%20Islands%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Cook Islands</a>, and at club level for <a href="Taniwharau%20Rugby%20League%20Club">Taniwharau</a>, <a href="Waikato%20rugby%20league%20team">Waikato Cougars</a>, <a href="Wainuiomata%20Lions">Wainuiomata Lions</a>, <a href="Manly%20Warringah%20Sea%20Eagles">Manly Sea Eagles</a>, <a href="Northern%20Eagles">Northern Eagles</a> and <a href="Toukley%20Hawks">Toukley Hawks</a>, as a , or , and club level rugby union (RU) for the Te <a href="Wh%C4%81nau">Whānau</a> side.
Background.
He is of <a href="Cook%20Islanders">Cook Islanders</a>, <a href="M%C4%81ori%20people">Māori</a> and <a href="New%20Zealanders">New Zealand</a> descent.
Playing career.
Berryman attended <a href="Huntly%20College">Huntly College</a> and started his career playing for the <a href="Taniwharau%20Rugby%20League%20Club">Taniwharau</a> in the <a href="Waikato%20Rugby%20League">Waikato Rugby League</a> competition in 1993.
Berryman quickly became a <a href="Waikato%20Cougars">Waikato Cougars</a> representative. Berryman moved to the <a href="Wainuiomata%20Lions">Wainuiomata Lions</a> in 2000 so he could play in the inaugural season of the <a href="Bartercard%20Cup">Bartercard Cup</a>. He captained the Lions, pairing <a href="David%20Faiumu">David Faiumu</a> in the halves.
Berryman signed with the <a href="Manly%20Sea%20Eagles">Manly Sea Eagles</a> in 2001, playing in the <a href="NSWRL%20Premier%20League">NSWRL First Division</a>. He remained with the <a href="Northern%20Eagles">Northern Eagles</a> in 2002.
Representative career.
Berryman played for <a href="New%20Zealand%20M%C4%81ori%20rugby%20league%20team">New Zealand Māori</a> in 1999, and 2000 before switching allegiance to the <a href="Cook%20Islands%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Cook Islands</a>.
Berryman subsequently won caps for the <a href="Cook%20Islands%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Cook Islands</a> in the <a href="2000%20Rugby%20League%20World%20Cup">2000 Rugby League World Cup</a>.
Later years.
Berryman later switched to <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a>, playing for the Te <a href="Wh%C4%81nau">Whānau</a> side in the <a href="Central%20Coast%20%28New%20South%20Wales%29">Central Coast</a> <a href="Rugby%20sevens">Rugby sevens</a> Festival.
As of 2011, Berryman is the captain-coach of the <a href="Toukley%20Hawks">Toukley Hawks</a> in the <a href="Central%20Coast%20Division%20Rugby%20League">Central Coast Division of Country Rugby League</a> and has convinced former teammate <a href="John%20Hopoate">John Hopoate</a> to join the club.
